content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # split the markdown document into individual lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # create an empty string to store the extracted code
    code = ""

    # iterate over each line and check if it is a code block
    for line in lines
        # if the line starts with ``` and ends with ``` then it is a code block
        if occursin(r"^\s*```julia\s*$", line) && occursin(r"\s*```\s*$", line)
            # extract the julia code from the line
            julia_code = match(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", line).captures[1]
            # remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
            code *= replace(replace(julia_code, r"^\s*```julia\n?" => ""), r"\n```$" => "\n")
        end
    end

    return code
end
